# Duas for Hajj & Umrah

## Entering the Mosque
- “Allahumma iftah li abwaba rahmatik.”

## Talbiyah
- “Labbayk Allahumma labbayk...”

## Between Yemeni Corner & Black Stone
- “Rabbana atina fi al-dunya hasanah…”

## General Supplications
- Any Qur'an, dhikr, or personal dua.

# Hajj Steps – Summary (Hajj al-Tamattu’)

## Day 8 – Tarwiyah
- Enter Ihram. - Go to Mina and pray Dhuhr to Isha shortened. ## Day 9 – Arafah
- Stand at Arafah until sunset. - Go to Muzdalifah, pray Maghrib + Isha. ## Day 10 – Eid Day
- Throw Jamarat al-Aqabah. - Sacrifice. - Shave hair. - Tawaf al-Ifadah + Sa’i.

## Days 11–13 – Tashreeq
- Throw all three Jamarat each day. ## Farewell Tawaf
- Final tawaf before leaving Makkah.

# Ihram Rules

## Obligations (Wajib)
- Enter Ihram with intention (niyyah). - Chant Talbiyah: “Labbayk Allahumma labbayk...”

## Prohibitions
- Cutting hair or nails. - Using scented products. - Contracting marriage. - Hunting animals. - For men: covering the head with fitted cloth. - For women: covering the face with niqab or wearing gloves.

## Sunnahs of Ihram
- Ghusl before Ihram. - Wearing white garments for men. - Two rak’ahs before making intention. ## Invalidations
- Breaking Ihram rules intentionally → requires fidya.

title: "Sa’i Between Safa and Marwah"
source: "Ministry of Hajj — Official Guide 2024"
source_url: "https://www.haj.gov.sa/guide"
date_added: "2025-11-21"
version: "1.0"
reviewed_by: "Jouri Aldaghma"
confidence: "high"
tags: ["ritual","sai","procedure"]
---

# Sa’i Between Safa and Marwah

## 1. After Tawaf
- Perform Sa'i immediately after Tawaf if doing Umrah or Hajj Tamattu'. ## 2. Start at As-Safa
- Face the Ka'bah, raise hands, make dhikr and dua. ## 3. Number of Paths
- 7 paths: Safa → Marwah counts as 1. - Marwah → Safa counts as 2, and so on until 7. ## 4.

Green Light Area (Men)
- Jog lightly between the green markers. ## 5. At Every End
- Stop at Safa or Marwah, raise hands, and make dua. ## 6. Completion
- Ends at Marwah on the 7th lap.

title: "Tawaf (Circumambulation) – Authentic Steps"
source: "Ministry of Hajj — Official Guide 2024"
source_url: "https://www.haj.gov.sa/guide"
date_added: "2025-11-21"
version: "1.0"
reviewed_by: "Jouri Aldaghma"
confidence: "high"
tags: ["ritual","tawaf","procedure"]
---

# Tawaf (Circumambulation) – Authentic Steps

## 1. Preparation
- Be in a state of wudu (recommended). - Ensure you are in Ihram if required by your type of Hajj/Umrah. - Approach al-Masjid al-Haram with the right foot and recite the dua of entering. ## 2. Starting Tawaf
- Begin at the Black Stone (al-Hajar al-Aswad).

- Face it, raise your hand, and say “Allahu Akbar.”

## 3. Number of Circuits
- Tawaf is 7 complete rounds around the Ka'bah. - Move counter-clockwise with the Ka'bah on your left. ## 4. Duas
- No fixed dua is required. - You may recite Qur’an, dhikr, or personal supplications. ## 5. Raml (Men Only)
- First 3 rounds: brisk walk (raml) for men if the area permits. ## 6. Between Yemeni Corner and Black Stone
- Sunnah to say: “Rabbana atina fi al-dunya hasanah wa fi al-akhirati hasanah wa qina ‘adhab an-nar.”

## 7.

Completion
- After the 7th round, pray two rak’ahs behind Maqam Ibrahim if possible.

title: "Umrah Steps – Summary"
source: "Ministry of Hajj — Official Guide 2024"
source_url: "https://www.haj.gov.sa/guide"
date_added: "2025-11-21"
version: "1.0"
reviewed_by: "Jouri Aldaghma"
confidence: "high"
tags: ["umrah","steps","summary"]
---

# Umrah Steps – Summary

1. Enter Ihram + Intention. 2. Recite Talbiyah until reaching Ka'bah. 3. Perform Tawaf (7 rounds). 4. Pray 2 rak’ahs behind Maqam Ibrahim. 5. Drink Zamzam. 6. Perform Sa’i. 7. Shave/Trim hair. 8. Umrah completed.
